clinical_study.brief_title: Self-Management Using Smartphone Application for Chronic Disease Care in Real siTuation (SMART-Asthma): Adult
clinical_study.official_title: Self-Management Using Smartphone Application for Chronic Disease Care in Real siTuation (SMART-Asthma) in Adult

brief_summary.textblock: Bronchial asthma is an chronic airway disease with bronchial hypersensitivity due to inflammation and bronchial muscle contraction. It can cause recurrent dyspnea, cough, wheezing and severe life-threatening attack and lower quality of life. In addition, it make large amount of socioeconomic loss as about 3.7 billion US dollars.

primary_outcome.measure: The efficacy of smartphone application for asthma control test (ACT)and quality of life
primary_outcome.description: Using ACT and ALQL score (QoL), we will investigate the efficacy of smanrtphone application for control of asthma compared to smartphone app. using group and smartphone app. non-using group

secondary_outcome.measure: FEV1 (Forced expiratory volume in 1 second ) and FVC (Forced vital capacity)
secondary_outcome.description: Using spirometer to check the variation of FEV1,we will investigate the efficacy of smanrtphone application for control of asthma compared to smartphone app. using group and smartphone app. non-using group

Using medical record and questionaire of acute exacerbation,we will investigate the efficacy of smanrtphone application for control of asthma compared to smartphone app. using group and smartphone app. non-using group

arm_group.description: Using smartphone application for control of asthma
non-using smartphone application for control asthma

intervention.description: The smartphone application for self-management of Asthma offers symptom diary, general information for asthma, the information of asthma drugs,the guideline for inhaler and the specific action plan according to daily symptom and FEV1.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- using smartphone
- alleged bronchial asthma over 3months & positive of bronchodilator response test or bronchial provocation test
Exclusion Criteria:
- COPD
- active pulmonary TUBERCULOSIS
- Acute exacerbation within 4weeks
- severe psychological disorder
- severe systemic disease; severe LC, ESRD ...
- MALIGNANCY
